basic_info.description: As a seasoned software engineer with over 2 years of hands-on experience, I excel in both server-side and client-side development. My technical expertise spans across a variety of technologies including React/ React Native, TypeScript, Node.js, Nest.js, Express.js, Rabbit MQ, CSS,GraphQL, FastAPI, Terraform, and AWS. I have a Master's in Computer Science from Indiana University Bloomington and a Bachelor's in Information Technology from Anna University. My professional journey includes significant contributions to infrastructure optimization, database operations, and the implementation of RESTful microservices. I am adept at leveraging tools like Express.js, Redux, and Next.js to enhance application performance and user experience. Certified in AWS and Azure, I thrive in Agile environments and have a proven track record of driving project success.

education.course_work: Object-Oriented Software Development, Distributed Systems, Cross-platform Mobile Programming, Applied Machine Learning

Algorithm Design & Analysis, Advanced Data structures, Machine Learning Fundamentals, Probability and Statistics, Database Management  systems, Software Engineering, Principles of Operating Systems, Cloud Computing & Virtualization.

projects.title: Travel Wizard
projects.description: Coordinated a team of three developers, and supervised the UI and integration of new features in the application while troubleshooting issues and tuning the application’s performance. Thus enhancing the response time by 24%. Designed the overall web application system architecture while incorporating CI/CD pipelines. Led and implemented server API endpoints along with middleware, and as a database admin, structured data models to satisfy up to 3NF.

projects.title: Distributed Key-Value Store
projects.description: Developed a sophisticated distributed key-value store in Java, employing UDP and Multicast protocols for efficient network communication and leveraging Memcached for enhanced object storage. Engineered to support multiple consistency models including sequential, eventual, linearizability, and causal consistency.

projects.title: Advanced Bio-Medical Knowledge Graphs - LLM Integration
projects.description: Investigated the integration of Large Language Models (LLMs) to enhance medical knowledge graph accuracy, focusing on reducing hallucinatory outputs crucial for clinical reliability. Focussing on patient-disease-diagnosis-drug relationship. Created an automated Named Entity Recognition (NER) system using advanced models like BioBERT, GPT-4, and other fine-tuned models from Hugging Face Transformers, achieving up to 89.1% accuracy in extracting medical entities, which facilitated the construction of knowledge graphs from complex medical texts. [BioBERT, Claude, GPT-4, Spacy]

projects.title: FlickMatch
projects.description: Designed ORM using Spring Hibernate and DAO repository layer using JPA Entity Manager. Implemented proactive health-check API, and employed unit testing using JUnit. Caching using AWS ElastiCache for better response time. Utilized Redux library for state management of components and flux architecture for improved scalability. Employed sensors for faster authentication and refined recommendations.

projects.title: Map Reduce
projects.description: Designed and implemented a distributed MapReduce systemin Java, capable of running on both single and cluster environments. The system uses network sockets(TCP) for inter-node communication and local file systems for data storage, adhering to a distributed architecture without shared disk access.

projects.title: Digitization of Answer Scripts
projects.description: Extensively analyzed multiple research publications on image segmentation, and engineered a deep learning pipeline to extract different elements fromanswer scripts, that comprise three distinct phases, CNN-PSPNet segment generation, contour extraction, and Question Paper based image reconstruction, digitized the final images using AWS Textract. Deployed the final model with 68% IoU(accuracy) in triangulating question numbers position, using Pyhton’s Flask.

experience.title: Software Engineer Intern
mainTech: React.js, Redux, Node.js, Nest.js, AWS, Mocha
experience.description: I pioneered lazy loading of React UI components, cutting load times by up to 50%, and designed Redux thunks for asynchronous server calls, reducing Total Blocking Time by 150ms.` By integrating domain-based Redis caching, I decreased average request latency by 40%, and utilized AWS Auto Scaling to achieve 99.99% uptime for microservices and UI applications.` I developed and unit-tested over 50 REST APIs in Node.js, implementing robust security mechanisms such as LDAP, OAuth, and JWT.` Leveraging Figma templates and Tailwind CSS, I ensured UI consistency, while optimizing PostgreSQL and MongoDB schema improved data retrieval speeds by 50% and maintained 99.9% data availability.` My Test-Driven Development approach, using Mocha and other tools, coupled with A/B testing, resulted in 20% fewer cross-feature bugs.

experience.title: Security Operation Intern
mainTech: SSH, Azure, Security Engineering, Network Security
experience.description: Effectively handling tier 1 technical analysis and response for cybersecurity incidents to end users and IT staff. Resolved 40% of backlog tickets by developing a log parser that extracts information needed for rapid tier 1 analysis. Thoroughly trained and acted cautiously to adhere to FREPA regulations and University policies in day-to-day operations.

experience.title: Software Engineer
experience.description: I leveraged Next.js framework’s Server-Side Rendering (SSR) to boost SEO, increasing user engagement by 40%, and implemented Redux Toolkit for state management, reducing memory management bugs by 80%.` By optimizing Webpack configurations, I improved asset management and reduced First Contentful Paint (FCP) latency by 40%.` I spearheaded the development of RESTful microservices for a Record Management System, increasing throughput by 30% and achieving 99.99% uptime.` Additionally, I enhanced SQL query performance with indexing techniques, cutting query latency by 40%, and optimized S3 bucket life-cycle management, lowering cloud costs by 15%.` I also automated CI/CD pipelines using GitHub events with AWS CodePipeline, speeding up product deployments by 30%, and integrated AWS CloudWatch logs with Splunk for performance analysis.` Employing Agile methodologies, including Scrum practices, boosted team productivity by 40%.

publications.title: Advanced Network Surgery Technique Predicting Paddy Leaf Diseases
publications.author: Doniparthi Sai Charan, Mettukuru Avinash Reddy
publications.publisher: INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF ENGINEERING RESEARCH & TECHNOLOGY (IJERT)
publications.abstract: Agriculture plays a chiefly role in economy as well as it is considered to be the backbone of economic system for developing countries. For decades, agriculture has been related with the production of vital food crops. Paddy rice is a staple crop for much of the worlds population. It is also a key source of the greenhouse gas methane, responsible for about 40 million tonnes, or 10% of global emissions, each year. Thus, the proposed research work aims to predict the type of disease in a paddy plant to help the farmer in deciding the fertilizer that shall be given to the plant for its healthy growth. Here the trending deep learning technology is used to achieve the proposed solution. An innovative modified VGGNet architecture is proposed which uses two different types of optimization technique to increase the accuracy is used for training the dataset. Then the trained model that is generated by this algorithm is given as an input to the next algorithm where resnet is used to further increase the accuracy of the model. The datasets were collected from UCI real time images as well as the GitHub datasets and the training are performed. The three different types of paddy disease such as bacterial leaf blight, blast, brown spot is used for prediction. The three different types of datasets used were UCI repository, Github images as well as images searched from internet. The experimental results of three diseases show that 97% of accuracy is achieved in predicting the type of disease in paddy plant.
publications.cite: Doniparthi Sai Charan, Mettukuru Avinash Reddy, 2022, Advanced Network Surgery Technique Predicting Paddy Leaf Diseases, INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF ENGINEERING RESEARCH & TECHNOLOGY (IJERT) CCICS – 2022 (Volume 10 – Issue 13)
